result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakota Jacob POHL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: under the Huber Law, to commence immediately.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Count 2 - Possess Methamphetamine - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1, 3 and 4.   Motion granted.   Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for sixty (60) days, under the Huber Law, to commence immediately.  
$518.00 court costs imposed, to be paid from cash bail.   
Submit DNA sample.  
Court denies the request for expungment.   
Minutes.
Plea date on June 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea Date set for 06-02-2016 at 2:00 p.m., Br. 2.

Stipulation and Order to Amend Bail Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the bail bond previously rendered herein shall be amended from no contact with Miranda Hansen to the defendant is allowed contact with Miranda Hansen for the purpose of visiting and caring for his recently born baby girl, A. R. P., DOB: 03-25-2016 under the supervision of any grandparent of A.R.P., DOB: 03-25-2016.
Copy delivered to jail.
Plea date on May 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 01-06-16 at 11:00 a.m.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 11/24/2015, at 11:15 a.m.

Notice of Motion; Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection; Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Notice of Motion to Dismiss Illegal Stop and Arrest; Motion to Dismiss Illegal Stop and Arrest.
Cover letter.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 10-16-15 at 2:30 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
BAIL MODIFICATION MOTION
Bail condition of defendant residing at his parent's home is modified to allow him to attend any treatment facility which he may have to stay overnight.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess heroin, possess Methamphetamine, possess paraphernalia, possess THC.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-31-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he reside with his parents and maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for controlled substances prescribed to him and taken as prescribed.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
